identified-content.object.title: FIRST NEW YORK INTERNATIONAL FESTIVAL OF THE ARTS

block.p: LEAD: For a recorded complete list of events, the number in New York is 587-1111; from outside New York State, (800) 782-4369. Tickets are available from the individual theaters. FRIDAY JVC JAZZ FESTIVAL, listing of all jazz festival events on page C22. AMERICAN BALLROOM THEATER, 8 P.M., Triplex, 199 Chambers St.; 618-1980.

LEAD: For a recorded complete list of events, the number in New York is 587-1111; from outside New York State, (800) 782-4369. Tickets are available from the individual theaters. FRIDAY JVC JAZZ FESTIVAL, listing of all jazz festival events on page C22. AMERICAN BALLROOM THEATER, 8 P.M., Triplex, 199 Chambers St.; 618-1980.

For a recorded complete list of events, the number in New York is 587-1111; from outside New York State, (800) 782-4369. Tickets are available from the individual theaters. FRIDAY JVC JAZZ FESTIVAL, listing of all jazz festival events on page C22. AMERICAN BALLROOM THEATER, 8 P.M., Triplex, 199 Chambers St.; 618-1980. ''ARCHPRIEST AVVAKUM,'' 9 P.M., Cathedral of St. John the Divine, Amsterdam Ave. at 112th St.; 662-2133. ''BOUTIQUE LIVING AND DISPOSABLE ICONS,'' by Momoko Iko; directed by Tisa Chang, 8 P.M., Pan Asian Repertory, Perry St. Theater, 31 Perry St.; 245-2660. Opens tonight. ''A CIRCLE,'' 8 P.M., Theater for the New City. 155 First Ave., at 10th St.; 254-1109. CONTRABAND, 8 P.M., ''Oracle.'' Brooklyn Bridge Anchorage, Cadman Plaza and Front St., Brooklyn; 619-1955. CRICOT 2, 8 P.M., ''I Shall Never Return.'' La Mama E.T.C., 74A E. Fourth St.; 475-7710. ''DEATHWATCH'' 8 P.M., Aaron Davis Hall, City College, West 133d St. at Convent Ave.; 690-4100. ''AN EVENING OF TWO ONE-ACT MUSICALS,'' 8 P.M., Intar Theater, 420 W. 42d St.; 465-1761. EVEN ORCHESTRA, 8 P.M., ''Dog Songs.'' Dance Theater Workshop, 219 W. 19th St.; 924-0077. ''FLOW MY TEARS, THE POLICE MAN SAID,'' 8 P.M., New York University, Tisch School of the Arts, Mainstage One, 721 Broadway, at Waverly Pl.; 998-1850. GERALD BROWN, 9 P.M., ''John Henry.'' Performance Space, 150 First Ave.; 477-5288. ''GREEN CARD,'' 8 P.M., Joyce Theater, 175 Eighth Ave., at 19th St.; 242-0800. ''I'LL GO ON,'' 8 P.M., Mitzi E. Newhouse Theater at Lincoln Center; 239-6200. ''JUNO AND THE PAYCOCK,'' 8 P.M., John Golden Theater, 252 W. 45th St.; 239-6200. LAIBACH, 9 P.M., the Kitchen, 512 W. 19th St.; 255-5793. ''LONG DAY'S JOURNEY INTO NIGHT,'' 8 P.M., Neil Simon Theater, 250 W. 52d St.; 757-8646, MARATHON OF NEW ONE-ACT PLAYS, 7:30 P.M., Ensemble Studio Theater, 549 W. 52d St.; 247-3405. W. 52d St.; 247-3405. MARTHA CLARKE, 8 P.M. ''Miracolo d'Amore.'' Public Theater, 425 Lafayette St.; 598-7150. NEW YORK SHAKESPEARE FESTIVAL, 8 P.M., ''The Death of Garcia Lorca.'' Public Theater, 425 Lafayette St.; 598-7150. ''THE NIGHT OF THE IGUANA,'' preview, 8 P.M., Circle in the Square Theater, 1633 Broadway, at 50th St.; 307-2704. ''V & V ONLY,'' 8 P.M., Circle Repertory Theater, 99 Seventh Ave. at Fourth St.; 924-7100. VIDEO DOCUMENTARY SERIES, 1 P.M., the Kitchen, 512 W. 19th St.; 255-5793. ''YOU HAVE COME BACK,'' 8 P.M., Ubu Repertory Theater. St. Clement's Church, 423 W. 46th St.; 279-4200. ''YOU STRIKE THE WOMAN, YOU STRIKE THE ROCK,'' 8 P.M., the Women's Project. Apple Corps Theater, 336 W. 20th St.; 382-2750. SATURDAY AMERICAN BALLROOM THEATER, (see Friday). ''A CIRCLE,'' (see Friday), 2 and 8. CONTRABAND, (see Friday). CRICOT 2, (see Friday). ''DEATHWATCH'' (see Friday), 3 and 8. EVEN ORCHESTRA, (see Friday). ''AN EVENING OF TWO ONE-ACT MUSICALS,'' (see Friday), 3 and 8. ''FLOW MY TEARS, THE POLICE MAN SAID,'' (see Friday), 2 and 8. ''GREEN CARD,'' (see Friday), 5 and 9. ''I'LL GO ON,'' (see Friday). ''JUNO AND THE PAYCOCK,'' (see Friday). ''LONG DAY'S JOURNEY INTO NIGHT,'' (see Friday), 2 and 8. ''MARATHON OF NEW ONE-ACT PLAYS,'' (see Friday), 5 and 9. MARTHA CLARKE, (see Friday), 3 and 8. NEW YORK CITY BALLET, 8 P.M., ''Apollo,'' ''Orpheus'' and ''Agon.'' New York State Theater; 870-5570. NEW YORK SHAKESPEARE FESTIVAL, (see Friday), 3 and 8. ''THE NIGHT OF THE IGUANA,'' (see Friday), preview, 2 and 8. ''SAND'' 8 P.M., Sandglass Theater. 92d St. Y, 1395 Lexington Ave.; 427-4410. WASHINGTON SQUARES, 3 P.M., Central Park Band Shell, at 72d St.; 860-1335. WOMEN'S PROJECT LECTURE, 2 P.M.,''On Theatrical Space.'' Japan Society, 333 E. 47th St.; 382-2750. ''YOU HAVE COME BACK,'' (see Friday), 3 and 8. VIDEO DOCUMENTARY SERIES, (see Friday). ''YOU STRIKE THE WOMAN, YOU STRIKE THE ROCK,'' (see Friday), 3 and 8. SUNDAY ''ANTIGONA FURIOSA,'' 3 P.M., Staged readings. Apple Corps Theater, 336 W. 20th St.; 382-2750. ARROW, Central Park Band Shell, at 72d St.; 860-1335. ''A CIRCLE,'' (see Friday), 3. CRICOT 2, (see Friday), 3 and 7. ''DEATHWATCH'' (see Friday), 3. ''AN EVENING OF TWO ONE-ACT MUSICALS,'' (see Friday), 3 and 8. ''FLOW MY TEARS, THE POLICE MAN SAID,'' (see Friday), 2 and 8. HOTHOUSE, 4 P.M., Music and dance improvisation. Performance Space 122, 150 First Ave.; 477-5288. ''I'LL GO ON,'' (see Friday), 3. ''MARATHON OF NEW ONE-ACT PLAYS,'' (see Friday), 5 and 9. MARTHA CLARKE, (see Friday), 3 and 8. NEW STOCKHOLM CHAMBER ORCHESTRA, 5 P.M., Alice Tully Hall; 362-1911. NEW YORK CITY BALLET, 7 P.M., ''In G Major,'' ''Opus 19/ The Dreamer'' and ''Glass Pieces.''
